{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3562604,"name":"TrentChang","username":"TrentChang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b9e5f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T03:14:17.464Z","cooked":"

Hi I‚Äôm from team 7636 Robomania, we‚Äôve encountered a problem that 6 AWG black wire is too short. We‚Äôre curious if it is legal to connect two 6AWG wire by using screws to connect them (by the way the wire is use to connect Anderson SB and PDH).

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T03:14:17.464Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":172.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"TrentChang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69637,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562609,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T03:20:41.113Z","cooked":"

What do you mean by screws? Do you have pictures or links of what you want to use for a splice?

I need to go back and review the rules for legality, but there may be another reason NOT to do this and to replace with 1 continuous wire instead:

This wire between your battery and PDH experiences ALL of the current your robot is consuming to perform its functions. That‚Äôs likely over 100Amps.

A splice like you propose, although electrically OK on a temporary basis, introduces an extra point of resistance which will further restrict the power delivered to your loads (motors, actuators, etc‚Ä¶).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T03:20:41.113Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":66.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562611,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T03:23:02.516Z","cooked":"

Use a 6AWG ‚Äúbutt splice‚Äù connector if you‚Äôre not going to just replace the wire. Too many possible issues with doing a screws-and-electrical-tape connection.

@Jwal you‚Äôd use a ring terminal on each end you want to connect, and screw the ring terminals together. It‚Äôs workable‚Äìbut I don‚Äôt like that for a variety of reasons. Not illegal that I‚Äôm aware of, but ugly and needs to be insulated VERY carefully and thoroughly.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T03:23:02.516Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":71.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562616,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T03:27:00.892Z","cooked":"

Ah - I understand now, a bolted joint.

What are your thoughts of R609 and the explicit exceptions E, F, and G to the wording ‚Äúno additional devices or modifications are permitted with the following exceptions:‚Äù

I read that as preventing this repair; competition-legal wise.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T03:27:45.465Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R609","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R609 | FRCTools","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562623,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T03:30:27.822Z","cooked":"

G609.G might beg to differ? Termination with cable lug. It‚Äôs just wide enough to possibly sneak this through.

I think this might actually be a good Q&A question: ‚ÄúIs it legal to place a properly sized and rated splice connector on wires required by R609, for the purpose of extending their length?‚Äù

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T03:30:27.822Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":68.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562649,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T04:00:58.485Z","cooked":"

I agree a Q&A would be good.

As an EE when I read ‚Äúcable lug‚Äù, to me that means final cable termination with a ring terminal or screw ‚Äúlug‚Äù.

But there are multi-position ‚Äúlugs‚Äù that would effectively splice‚Ä¶

So I think there is a sliver of gray area here that may benefit from clarification: and no answer is an answer as well, effectively green-lighting the gray area erring on the side of repairability.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T04:00:58.485Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://lugsdirect.com/single-wire-lugs.htm","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Single Wire Lugs, 1 Wire Termination per Lug on LugsDirect.com","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562663,"name":"TrentChang","username":"TrentChang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b9e5f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T04:18:34.958Z","cooked":"
EricH:

Use a 6AWG ‚Äúbutt splice‚Äù connector if you‚Äôre not going to just replace the wire. Too many possible issues with doing a screws-and-electrical-tape connection.

like screw nut u use to fixed the wire on the battery

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T04:18:34.958Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"TrentChang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69637,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562672,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T04:28:52.795Z","cooked":"

Get a ‚Äúbutt splice‚Äù connector if you‚Äôre going to do that.

Seriously. Just do it with that ‚Äúbutt splice‚Äù crimped connector. You‚Äôre not saving yourself anything by doing the screw-and-nut setup.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T04:28:52.795Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69637,"username":"TrentChang","name":"TrentChang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b9e5f3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562693,"name":"Dave Morrison","username":"davemorrison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/8dc957/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T05:33:43.529Z","cooked":"

When that‚Äôs happened to me, I‚Äôve used a new wire that‚Äôs long enough. The work to splice the wire is the same or more and introduces new potential failure points.

A crimp butt splice is a reasonable solution, though, and cover with heatshrink not tape. But I feel it‚Äôs similar work to put it new, and removes the opportunity for a mistake that would affect the whole bot.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T05:33:43.529Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Dave Morrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/9","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3562835,"name":"Drakxii","username":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T13:28:14.363Z","cooked":"

No. If you really don‚Äôt have a way to buy black 6 AWG before your event, the spare parts should have enough for you.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T13:28:14.363Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":49.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Drakxii","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23134,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI "},"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3563270,"name":"Dave Morrison","username":"davemorrison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/8dc957/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-20T19:37:30.576Z","cooked":"

And if you can‚Äôt find it there, if you were in one of the events I was at, I would give you (and I expect nearly any team that had extra) a few feet of 6ga red or black.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-20T19:37:30.576Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Dave Morrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":23134,"username":"Drakxii","name":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/11","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569656,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T23:55:44.749Z","cooked":"

Legal? I‚Äôd say yes, provided all of your splices were up to 6AWG standards and properly insulated.

But if you‚Äôre open to advice, eliminate every unnecessary connector, especially on the mains (battery-breaker-PD[PH]). Can you fix this issue by moving the breaker or PDH or battery a few inches? Maybe mount the battery the other direction? Can you perhaps change the wire out with a longer one you have on hand?

I see you‚Äôre in Taiwan, so I can‚Äôt suggest specific shops, but if you need to source more stranded wire (or a splice) locally, your most likely places are:

  • A parts or repair shop shop for trucks, tractors, or boats.
  • A welding supply shop, or welding shop that uses electrical welders

And way beyond what you asked: if you send a smooth talker along for the procurement, you may be able to get a sponsor rather than a bill! Local companies who sell or handle FRC crossover items make great sponsors:

  • They get their name on the robot, in your pit, on your shirts, at demos, in mentor and student minds, more; always a nice way to get their name to customers, and (not sure if this or something similar applies in Taiwan), they can list it as a ‚Äúcharitable donation‚Äù rather than an advertising expense because it supports education.
  • If some or all of their material support is ‚Äúin kind‚Äù (meaning parts rather than currency), even though they pay wholesale, give them sponsor credit at retail. Costs you essentially nothing, likely helps them with taxes.
  • You might get a mentor or two out of it, or some fabrication help. Maybe even some build space. A long shot, but it does happen, and it costs hardly anything to try.
  • You might help line up one or more of your students with their first STEM-applicable employment, and the sponsor with an employee who starts at the ground floor in pay, but with a clue. Especially if that student is hoping to become a technician, a high school or summer job working at such a place can support a better resume than one who worked at (for example) a restaurant or a grocery.

And of course, you can get a bit at competition for a call at pit admin.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T10:30:24.913Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496300,"topic_slug":"about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/about-battery-and-breaker-6-awg-wire-connection/496300/12","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570407,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T19:06:12.869Z","cooked":"

G. Termination of wires with appropriate cable lugs

If you can find a something sold as a cable lug rated for 6G wire, it should be legal. There are some for splicing 2 wires together. Properly done it is completely safe. It will probably get extra scrutiny at inspection with the LRI making the final decision. I would prefer to replace it with a longer piece of wire to avoid the issue.
